channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Rockefeller Center’s Christmas Tree cut down in upstate New York, standing a towering 75 feet tall
item.description: The 11-ton tree was loaded onto a 100-foot-long trailer as scores of people turned out for the occasion.

item.title: Elise Stefanik, close ally of Trump, announces run for governor of New York
item.description: The upstate New Yorker was previously tapped to become the president's ambassador to the United Nations, although that was pulled.

item.title: Peloton recalls nearly 878,000 exercise bikes after several seat posts break
item.description: Both consumer safety watchdogs and Peloton urge owners of these bikes to stop using them and contact the New York-based exercise company for a free se...

item.title: Asian universities turn into tourist destinations as Chinese students look closer to home for higher education
item.description: Tourists have long flocked to Western universities, like Oxford or Harvard—but visitors are now adding Asian campuses to their itineraries.

item.title: Hertz sees 20% spike in one-way rentals amid air traffic chaos
item.description: America seems to be hitting the road as its air fleet is increasingly grounded.

item.title: Dow, S&P 500 fight back to close on gains, as tech’s struggles drag Nasdaq lower
Dow breaks into green in final hour as stocks attempt to fight back from losses
Shutdown starting to ‘bite the economy,’ Trump aide warns, with no deal apparent
Tech heads for worst week since April. Is it just stocks letting off steam?
Home prices are overinflated in many parts of the U.S. Is it a housing bubble?
